title: Greek Food Vocabulary
description: Explore the vocabulary of Greek cuisine, from moussaka to baklava

questions.question: In Greek cuisine, what is 'moussaka'?
options: A layered casserole of eggplant, minced meat, and bechamel sauce

questions.question: What is 'tzatziki' in Greek food?
options: A creamy dip or sauce made from yogurt, cucumber, garlic, and herbs

questions.question: What does 'souvlaki' refer to in Greek cuisine?
options: Small pieces of meat grilled on a skewer

questions.question: In Greek food, what is 'spanakopita'?
options: A savory pastry filled with spinach and feta cheese wrapped in phyllo dough

questions.question: What is 'baklava' in Greek and Middle Eastern cuisine?
options: A sweet pastry made of layers of phyllo filled with chopped nuts and soaked in honey syrup

questions.question: What does 'gyro' (or 'gyros') literally mean in Greek?
options: Turn or revolution — referring to meat cooked on a rotating vertical spit

questions.question: In Greek cuisine, what is 'dolmades' (or 'dolma')?
options: Grape leaves stuffed with rice, herbs, and sometimes meat

questions.question: What is 'feta' in Greek food?
options: A brined white cheese traditionally made from sheep's milk

questions.question: What does 'horiatiki' mean in Greek cuisine?
options: Village-style — the traditional Greek salad with tomatoes, cucumber, olives, and feta

questions.question: In Greek food, what is 'pastitsio'?
options: A baked pasta dish with layers of tubular pasta, meat sauce, and bechamel

questions.question: What is 'ouzo' in Greek culture?
options: An anise-flavored aperitif spirit that turns milky white when water is added

questions.question: What does 'meze' (or 'mezedes') refer to in Greek dining?
options: A selection of small dishes served as appetizers or snacks with drinks

questions.question: In Greek cuisine, what is 'avgolemono'?
options: A sauce or soup made from eggs and lemon, often with chicken broth

questions.question: What is 'loukoumades' in Greek food?
options: Small fried dough balls drizzled with honey and sprinkled with cinnamon

questions.question: What does 'phyllo' (or 'filo') mean in Greek?
options: Leaf — referring to paper-thin sheets of dough used in pastries
